title: S3300
author: S3300
content: Any kaspa coin miners on here? I heard you can dual mine this coin and the source said it makes more sense than other dual mining coins we know before can anyone confirm this.

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: S3300 on August 16, 2022, 04:44:43 PMAny kaspa coin miners on here? I heard you can dual mine this coin and the source said it makes more sense than other dual mining coins we know before can anyone confirm this.Worth depends on you electric bill. RTX 3070 do 61mh on ETH and use 120w - dualmining adds 40 - 50w and 305mh on kaspa = 300mh give you at the moment 150 kaspa - difficulty is exploding so it will be less in the next time - calculator say i must get around 300kaspa, but the reality say 150.You also need bigger PSU´sKaspa can give some extra cash, or you hold it - it rised much in the last days - but this is a gamble.You can also dual mining eth/etc/ubiq with heavyhash or now with Radiant (sha512-256D)

comments.author: S3300
comments.body: Thanks for the respond sxemini, how about the temp you are getting on your RTX 3070 when mining kaspa with Ethereum because I am very sure that once watt usage increase the temp will increase as well, so what's the temp you getting for using 170watt on a 3070 mining kaspa and ETH.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: S3300 on August 17, 2022, 09:46:52 AMThanks for the respond sxemini, how about the temp you are getting on your RTX 3070 when mining kaspa with Ethereum because I am very sure that once watt usage increase the temp will increase as well, so what's the temp you getting for using 170watt on a 3070 mining kaspa and ETH.The temperature depends on your cooling system. In closed cases, there will be fewer problems, but you will have to increase the speed of the case fans. In open cases in the summer, I do not use the dual mode, because the video cards overheat. Try this mode on one mining farm to see your temperatures.

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: S3300 on August 17, 2022, 09:46:52 AMThanks for the respond sxemini, how about the temp you are getting on your RTX 3070 when mining kaspa with Ethereum because I am very sure that once watt usage increase the temp will increase as well, so what's the temp you getting for using 170watt on a 3070 mining kaspa and ETH.I get 60C with 50% fan on my RTX3070´s and without dualmining i get around 50C. It is nearly the same like ETH+TON in the pastThe RX6900XT can do 61mh ETH + 700mh KASPA/HEAVYHASH @ 230w

comments.author: Pterosaur
comments.body: Quote from: sxemini on August 17, 2022, 10:07:15 AMQuote from: S3300 on August 17, 2022, 09:46:52 AMThanks for the respond sxemini, how about the temp you are getting on your RTX 3070 when mining kaspa with Ethereum because I am very sure that once watt usage increase the temp will increase as well, so what's the temp you getting for using 170watt on a 3070 mining kaspa and ETH.I get 60C with 50% fan on my RTX3070´s and without dualmining i get around 50C. It is nearly the same like ETH+TON in the pastThe RX6900XT can do 61mh ETH + 700mh KASPA/HEAVYHASH @ 230wI have interest in this so called Dual Mining, as a long time miner I've never tried it before and I don't even know how they work, do you have any online calculator for Dual Mining maybe? I will like to give this a shot right now.

comments.author: igotek
comments.body: Quote from: sxemini on August 17, 2022, 09:01:14 AMYou can also dual mining eth/etc/ubiq with heavyhash or now with Radiant (sha512-256D)Could you tell me examples with any coin for HiveOS ?I m mining ETH+KAS at the moment.

comments.author: doktor83
comments.body: Quote from: igotek on August 17, 2022, 02:58:51 PMQuote from: sxemini on August 17, 2022, 09:01:14 AMYou can also dual mining eth/etc/ubiq with heavyhash or now with Radiant (sha512-256D)Could you tell me examples with any coin for HiveOS ?I m mining ETH+KAS at the moment.You can do these combinations with SRBMiner :ethash + kaspaethash + blake3_alephiumethash + heavyhashethash + sha512_256d_radiantetchash + kaspaetchash + blake3_alephiumetchash + heavyhashetchash + sha512_256d_radiantautolykos2 + kaspaautolykos2 + blake3_alephiumautolykos2 + heavyhashautolykos2 + sha512_256d_radiant

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: sxemini on August 17, 2022, 10:07:15 AMQuote from: S3300 on August 17, 2022, 09:46:52 AMThanks for the respond sxemini, how about the temp you are getting on your RTX 3070 when mining kaspa with Ethereum because I am very sure that once watt usage increase the temp will increase as well, so what's the temp you getting for using 170watt on a 3070 mining kaspa and ETH.I get 60C with 50% fan on my RTX3070´s and without dualmining i get around 50C. It is nearly the same like ETH+TON in the pastThe RX6900XT can do 61mh ETH + 700mh KASPA/HEAVYHASH @ 230wThis coin requires a higher core frequency. If you use lower core frequency settings, then the mining hashrate will be small, but there will be no overheating of the video card.But if you increase the core frequency, then the consumption increases and the video card overheats more.RX6900XT consumes about 150 watts in ethereum mining, and already 230 watts in dual mining

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Kaspa on Rust - First Stable ReleaseWe are excited to announce the first stable Rusty Kaspa (RK) node Release (version 0.14.1).This is a significant milestone for the Kaspa network, as it marks the point where we shift to a new improved and optimized engine, which can now be built upon and accelerated to its limits.Approx. 2 years ago, when I first proposed the Rust Rewrite, I dreamed of unleashed performance and superb code quality. Today I can say that the new codebase is of highest quality possible, and that the set of individuals contributing to it is now an elite group of people, forming a decentralized and world-spread core development force.https://medium.com/@michaelsuttonil/kaspa-on-rust-first-stable-release-636938596441
